section.title: Point in time database recovery
section.p: Everything is still running (deployer, cloud controller nodes (CCNs) and compute nodes (CPNs) but you want to restore the MySQL database to an old state.

ol.li:
On the first Mysql node run the following steps:
# Become root sudo su
# Create restore directory mkdir /tmp/hlm_mysql_restore/
# Source backup environment file source /opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/backup.osrc
# List jobs freezer-scheduler -c <hostname> job-list
# Get the id corresponding to the job "HLM Default: Mysql restore from Swift"
# Launch the restore freezer-scheduler -c <hostname> job-start -j <job-id>
# Wait for some time, you can follow the /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log
From the deployer run the following steps: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-stop.yml

On the first Mysql node run the following steps: # Clean Mysql directory sudo rm -r /var/lib/mysql/*
# Copy restored files sudo cp -pr /tmp/hlm_mysql_restore/* /var/lib/mysql
From the deployer node run the following steps: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts percona-bootstrap.yml

section.title: Restore from an SSH backup
section.p: Follow the same procedure as the one for Swift but select the job "HLM Default: Mysql restore from SSH".

section.title: Point in time swift rings recovery
section.p: Everything is still running (deployer, ccn's, cpn's) but you want to restore the Swift rings to an old state.
section.note: Freezer only does backup and restore for swift rings, not swift data.

ol.li:
On the first Swift Proxy (SWF-PRX[0]) node run the following steps: # Become root sudo su
# Create restore directorie mkdir /tmp/hlm_builder_dir_restore/
# Source backup environment file source /opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/backup.osrc
# List jobs freezer-scheduler -c <hostname> job-list
# Get the id corresponding to the job "HLM Default: Swift restore from Swift"
# Launch the restore freezer-scheduler -c <hostname> job-start -j <job-id>
# Wait for some time, you can follow the /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log

On the deployer:
cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts swift-stop.yml

On the first Swift Proxy (SWF-PRX[0]) run the following steps:
# Copy restored files cp -pr /tmp/hlm_builder_dir_restore/* /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/
On the deployer: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts swift-reconfigure.yml

section.title: Restore from an SSH backup
section.p: Follow the same procedure as the one for Swift but select the job "HLM Default: Swift restore from SSH".

section.title: Point in time deployer recovery
section.p: Everything is still running (deployer, ccn's, cpn's) but you want to restore the deployer to an old state.

ol.li:
On the deployer, run the following steps: # Become root sudo su
# Source backup environment file source /opt/stack/service/freezer-agent/etc/backup.osrc
# List jobs freezer-scheduler -c <deployer hostname> job-list
# Get the id corresponding to the job "HLM Default: Deployer restore from swift"
# Stop the Dayzero UI systemctl stop dayzero
# Launch the restore freezer-scheduler -c <deployer hostname> job-start -j <job-id>
# Wait for some time, you can follow the /var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log
# Start the Dayzero UI systemctl start dayzero

section.title: Restore from an SSH backup
section.p: Follow the same procedure as the one for Swift but select the job "HLM Default: Deployer restore from SSH"

section.title: One or two Ccn disaster recovery
section.p: Everything is still running (deployer, ccn, cpn's) but you lost one or two ccn.

section.title: Restore from other nodes
section.p: On the deployer node, let's install the nodes that got destroyed: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit padawan-ccp-c1-m2-mgmt

section.title: Restore from a Swift backup
section.p: You shouln't need to restore anything, the mysql database will be recovered automatically from other running nodes.
